title: Top 5 Farm Equipment Every Modern Farmer Needs

subtasks: Choose appropriate tractor size and horsepower
Perform regular tractor maintenance (e.g., check tire pressure, oil levels)
Select and adjust plow type (e.g., moldboard, chisel) for different soil conditions and crop requirements
Calibrate fertilizer spreaders for even nutrient distribution
Install and manage irrigation systems (e.g., drip, pivot)
Use moisture sensors for optimized water management
Adjust combine harvester settings for specific crops (e.g., wheat, corn, soybeans)
Utilize automated features (e.g., steering, yield monitoring)
Determine appropriate plowing depth based on crop needs
Address soil compaction with chisel plows
Differentiate between broadcast and drop spreaders
Use pivot irrigation for large fields
Integrate moisture sensors for precise watering
